author: cbs8
title: Applied Systems Announces Applied Mobile 2016
text:
Expanded product capabilities to extend mobility across agency and brokerage operations
University Park, Ill.
Applied Systems today announced the upcoming availability of Applied Mobile 2016, the latest release of the first mobile app designed specifically for the independent insurance agency and brokerage channel, at Applied Net 2015. Applied Mobile, formerly Applied MobileProducer, will increase enterprise mobility for an entire agency or brokerage by providing greater access to critical insurance information within Applied Epic and Applied TAM while away from the office. Available immediately, users can now access a new native app via an iOS® or Android smartphone device in addition to the previously available tablet version, providing increased on-the-go access to insurance information via multiple device types to improve productivity and customer service.
Applied Mobile enables insurance agency and brokerage staff to access and manage client, prospect, and overall business information anywhere, anytime via a mobile smartphone or tablet device. The touch-screen optimized interface enables users to stay connected on-the-go with a direct link to information in their agency or brokerage management system. The native mobile app allows users to view accounts, contact details and insurance policy information, add prospects, create and manage activities, and offers risk assessment tools that enable producers to accurately sell more lines of business. On-demand access to client and prospect information enables users to conduct more business outside the agency or brokerage and deliver better service to clients with a single, up-to-date view of client and business information.
Key enhancements for Applied Mobile 2016 include:
Applied Mobile for Smartphones: Applied Mobile is now available on iOS and Android smartphone devices, providing agencies and brokerages with expanded app capabilities, including enhanced GPS functionality, instant tap-to-call contacts through the app, and increased access to agency management system information on their daily smartphone device. Sales Automation: For Applied Mobile users seamlessly integrated to Applied Epic 2016, the app will deliver sales automation capabilities directly on the mobile device, enabling users to view, add and manage sales opportunities to remain connected with the sales process while in the office or on the road. Document Access: Users of Applied Mobile will have expanded real-time access to a wider range of client and prospect documents to enhance their in-person client service experience. “As the insurance industry becomes increasingly more connected, it is critical for insurance agencies and brokerages to leverage mobility solutions and weave this pervasive connectivity into their daily operations,” said Michael Howe, senior vice president of Product Management, Applied Systems. “Applied Mobile 2016 expands our market-leading mobile strategy to bring advanced mobile capabilities to all users at an agency or brokerages via multiple mobile device types. The net benefit is ubiquitous access to insurance information when and where employees need it for improved productivity and customer service.”
About Applied Systems
Applied Systems is a leading provider of software that powers the business of insurance. Applied is recognized as a pioneer in agency and brokerage management systems and data exchange between agencies, brokers, carriers and their clients. Automating the insurance lifecycle for more than 140,000 insurance professionals, 13,000 agencies and brokerages, and 450 carriers worldwide, Applied enables millions of people around the world to safeguard and protect what matters most.
